reason: PROOF PRESENTATION: The proof of the equivalent formula H_p(lambda_i) = p''(lambda_i)/(2p'(lambda_i)) contains multiple false starts, self-corrections, and erroneous intermediate claims (e.g., 'denominator -> 0 is wrong' appearing twice, incorrect product rule applications). While the FINAL derivation using h(x) = p(x)/(x-lambda_i) and the decomposition f = 1/(x-lambda_i) + g_i is CORRECT, the preceding ~60% of the proof text is wrong and confusing. A clean proof should be: (1) write p'(x) = h(x) + (x-lambda_i)h(x)g_i(x) where h = prod_{m\!=i}(x-lambda_m), g_i = sum_{j\!=i}1/(x-lambda_j); (2) differentiate and evaluate at lambda_i to get p''(lambda_i) = 2h(lambda_i)g_i(lambda_i) = 2p'(lambda_i)H_p(lambda_i). The definition itself and the equivalent formula are mathematically correct (verified with explicit examples p(x)=x(x-1) and p(x)=x(x-1)(x-3)).
